etymology.description: Pictogram: an ancient single-bladed weapon; the vertical handle became the long upper-left to lower-right diagonal stroke.
etymology.interpretation: Depicts a halberd with one blade: the long diagonal is the shaft, while the short horizontal-plus-hook forms the blade and its mounting. Compared with 我, which adds extra blades like a trident, this simpler form emphasizes a single cutting edge.

examples.chinese: 博物馆展出了青铜戈(博物館展出了青銅戈)。
古书常用“干戈”代指战争(古書常用「干戈」代指戰爭)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔshū cháng yòng “gāngē” dài zhǐ zhànzhēng.
examples.english: Ancient books often use “shield and halberd” as a metonym for war.

examples.chinese: 丝绸之路穿过戈壁(絲綢之路穿過戈壁)。
examples.english: The Silk Road passes through the Gobi Desert.
